result.execSummary:
The defendant Bobbi Jo Potvin was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possess w/ Intent-Amphetamine(<=3g), a class F felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(1m)(e)1.
  • Possess Drug Paraphernalia, an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 961.573(1).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes: The costs have been through defendant's bond.

Defendant shall submit to a DNA sample.  Defendant shall undergo counseling as deemed appropriate by probation.    Defendant shall pay supervision fees as ordered by the Department of Corrections. 
If probation is ordered and ultimately revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due.  All available enforcement actions will be used.
Defendant shall undergo an AODA assessment and follow through with any recommendations.

timeConds.notes:
The jail sentence shall begin no later than April 10, 2016 at 4:30 pm.  The defendant shall pay all sheriff and jail fees or costs allowed or imposed by law and the sheriff shall be entitled to a judgment against the defendant for any such unpaid fees or costs.  
Jail can be served in any county in the State of Wisconsin provided arrangements are made by counsel or the defendant, it is approved by the Taylor County Jail, and at no additional cost to Taylor County.

records.addlTxt: Defendant Bobbi Jo Potvin in court with attorney Shawn M Paul.  Defendant Bobbi Jo Potvin in custody.  Kristi S. Tlusty appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Plea agreement put into the record.  Plea of no contest to count 1 and count 2.  Plea colloquy.  Plea freely, voluntarily and intelligently; factual basis exists.  Court dismisses and read in count 3.  Court finds defendant guilty of counts 1 and 2. Argument regarding sentencing.  Court orders withheld sentence probation three years with conditions court costs; DNA sample and SC; AODA; counseling as deemed appropriate by probation; $32.98 service of process fees;  2 months county jail with huber to begin no later than April 10, 2016 at 4:30 pm    Count 2 - court costs are to be paid at the rate of $50.00 a month beginning April 1, 2016 - rt

Defendant Bobbi Jo Potvin in court with attorney Shawn M Paul.  Kristi S. Tlusty appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Atty Tlusty states parties need more time for negotiation.  Status conference scheduled for March 10, 2016 at 3:00 p.m. ba

Defendant Bobbi Jo Potvin in court with attorney Shawn M Paul.  Kristi S. Tlusty appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Written waiver of preliminary hearing filed.  Court questions defendant.  Defendant freely waives right to a preliminary hearing.  Court finds defendant freely waives right to a preliminary hearing and bind defendant over for trial.  Information filed.  Waive reading of information.  Plea of not guilty.  Status conference scheduled for January 15, 2016 at 08:45 am.  - rt
Order for Appearance at Settlement Conference; Report to Court on Results of Settlement Conference.

Defendant Bobbi Jo Potvin in court with attorney Shawn M Paul.  Kristi S. Tlusty appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Waive reading of complaint.  Waive time limits for a preliminary hearing.  Bond continued.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for November 2, 2015 at 01:30 pm.  - rt

*Defendant shall not leave the State of Wisconsin without prior notice to and written approval of the Court.  Must report to the Taylor County Sheriff's Office for Booking Procedure. Defendant shall not possess or consume controlled substances.

Court advised DE of potential charges and penalties; advised of right to attorney and notice given to DE.  Atty Tlusty requested a cash bond in the amount of $2,000.00 with standard conditions and to not posses or consume controlled subtances.  DE responded.  Court set $2,000.00 cash bond with booking and to not possess or consume contolled substances.  Initial appearance scheduled for August 25, 2015 at 2:00 p.m.. ba
